content: using floral wire use pliers to fold the tip of each so it is rounded if you decided not to pot your cactuar cut two pieces of leg 1 size attaching the arms - stuff the tip of the arm - insert wire rounded end first then stuff around the wire keeping the wire in the center of the arm - line up arms opposite each other slightly less than halfway down the body on a 90 degree angle from the body offset them slightly back from the front of the body as well center should be about between row 23 and 24 counting down from the top of the head insert rest of wire into the body angling down to add stability - sew arm to body - repeat for other arm attaching the free leg leg 1 - follow the same instructions above for attaching arms except a center leg and wire between about row 6 and 7 counting up from the bottom and b position leg at an angle downward to the body attaching planted leg leg 2 - insert long wire through the starting mc and leave about an inch and a half extending out the open end of the leg - stuff the leg around the wire keeping wire in the center - sew similar to the other leg the difference being there will be a long extension of wire extending on the opposite end into the pot final fantasy inspired cactuar in a pot detailing attaching the stripes on the body run a center string from head to center where we fastened the body off pull string taut and sew space the other two strings evenly to liking and bring to underside and sew as well using invisible thread lightly whipstitch threads in place to the body alternatively embroider stripes in the same pattern bend arms and legs to desired angles attach same as above face details ​ cut oval about 1 ½ inch long ½ inch wide out of black felt for mouth cut two felt circles for eyes about ½ inch in diameter position and glue to the body cut three pieces of pipecleaner about 1 ½ inches long attach last by simply inserting into top of head final fantasy inspired cactuar in a pot potting your cactuar insert wire extending from leg 2 through the center mc of your brown soil as well as through the hole you made in the cardboard wrap wire so it circles at the bottom of the pot fill the pot with rocks to get rocks on top of wire gently hold soil and cactuar in your pot and flip upside down then right-side up final fantasy-inspired moogle & cactuar patterns created by selse613 tonberry pattern by mevvsan black mage pattern by jana whitley final fantasy inspired cactuar in a pot
